thread.title: The 'other' Curry gets red-hot for Mavs on same night Stephen ties NBA record for missed 3s
thread.title_full: The 'other' Curry gets red-hot for Mavs on same night Stephen ties NBA record for missed 3s

author: Arthur Weinstein (awperform@gmail.com)
title: The 'other' Curry gets red-hot for Mavs on same night Stephen ties NBA record for missed 3s
text:
NBA February 28, 2017 1:20am EST February 28, 2017 1:19am EST Basketball, NBA, News, Dallas Mavericks, Golden State Warriors, Toronto Raptors, Washington Wizards, English Seth Curry scored 29 points Monday night, but big brother Stephen tied an NBA record for missed 3-point attempts in a game without a make. Stephen and Seth Curry (Getty Images) 
Updated at 1:20 a.m. ET 
Updated at 1:20 a.m. ET 
Seth Curry, better known as the younger brother of you know who, is starting to light up the scoreboard just like his older sibling. 
The 26-year-old guard scored 29 points Monday night to lead theÂ Mavericks to a 96-89 victory over the Heat. Seth heat check results: đĽđĽđĽ #CurryRange pic.twitter.com/8gFzfGy9Ak â NBA (@NBA) February 28, 2017 
Meanwhile, older brother Stephen tied an NBA record for futility in a win against the 76ers. He missed all 11 of his 3-point attempts, tying an NBA record for most misses in a game without a make. 
More on that later, because this night belonged to Seth Curry. Coupled with his career-high 31 points against the Timberwolves Friday, the younger Curry is averaging a stout 24.3 points per game in Dallas' three games since the All-Star break. 
"He's a very, very confident young man," Dirk Nowitzki told reporters after Friday's game. "He just has that attitude about him that he's supposed to score on anybody. And that's what he's been doing out there. He's been good in the pick-and-rolls. We've been seeing the entire package from him for a long time now. He's a legit scorer. I'm happy for him." 
This is definitely new territory for a guard who went undrafted out of Duke in 2013, then bounced around betweenÂ short stints with more than a half dozen teamsÂ in the NBA, its summer leagueÂ and theÂ D-League before finally gettingÂ significant playing time last season in Sacramento. 
Now Seth hasÂ found a home in Dallas, where he's averaging 12Â points per game. He's also displayed some versatility. In Saturday's win against the Jazz, he only scored 13 points, but he added eight assists and seven rebounds. And he definitely has that Curry family shooting touch. 
In fact, Seth's shooting percentageÂ of .474 and 3-point percentage of .422 this season are both higher than Steph's (.470 and .415). 
The two-time NBA MVP certainly didn't help his stats with his poor shooting Monday night. Included in that performance were two first-quarter airballs. 
âThe weatherman said a low pressure system was coming in and I forgot to adjust to the thinness of the air,â Curry joked afterward to reporters. âIt happens.â 
For one night, at least, Seth had clear bragging rights in the Curry family. 
Stud of the night 
DeMar DeRozan scored 37 points and grabbed eight boards for the Raptors, andÂ hit the game-winning 18-foot shot with less than 2 secondsÂ remaining in Toronto'sÂ 92-91 victory over the Knicks in New York. DeMar hits the game winner at the Garden! #WeTheNorth pic.twitter.com/AejZQBblCd â NBA (@NBA) February 28, 2017 
Dud of the night 
Boston's Isaiah Thomas has been a scoring beast this season, but he misfired Monday night in a 114-98 loss to the Hawks. The 5-9 Celtics guard hit only 4-of-21Â shots from the field, scoring 19 points. That ended his franchise-record streak of 43 straight games with 20 points or more.Â He also turned the ball over sevenÂ times, although he did add sevenÂ rebounds and assists. 
Highlight â NBA (@NBA) February 28, 2017 
What's next 
Warriors (49-9) at Â WizardsÂ (34-23), 7 p.m. ET â The best record in the West against the fourth-best record in the East. The Wizards' underrated backcourt of John Wall (22.9 points per game) and Bradley Beal (22.6) pose a big test for the Warriors, who will play the second game of a five-game road trip against Eastern Conference teams.
